unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Spinning the Roulette Wheel and the Law of Large Numbers
question_text: In the game of American roulette, a small ball will randomly land inside one of $38$ colored and numbered pockets on a spinning wheel. Two of these numbered pockets are green, $18$ are red, and $18$ are black. In a large casino, the wheel is spun several hundred times per day. Based on the Law of Large Numbers, which of the following situations is most likely to occur?

choices.text: 2 2 out of the first 38 spins 38 spins of the wheel on any given day should result in the ball landing in a green pocket.
Approximately 5.3 % 5.3 % of all spins of the wheel during the year should result in the ball landing in a green pocket.
The probability that the ball will land in a green pocket on any given spin of the wheel is 1 19 1 19 .
Approximately 1 19 1 19 of the spins of the wheel on any given day should result in the ball landing in a green pocket.
On any given spin of the wheel, approximately 5.3 % 5.3 % of people who bet that the ball will land in a green pocket will win their bet.
